document_data.name: Detect Good
document_data.spheres2e: [[All sphere|All]], [[Divination sphere|Divination]]<ref group="note">This spell was removed from the [[All sphere]] and placed in the [[Divination sphere]] by the [[Player's Option: Spells & Magic]] sourcebook. See page 186.
document_data.mainbody: '''''Detect good''''' was a [[divination]] spell that provided information about objects or creatures with a [[good]] aura. Some versions of this spell were reversible, becoming ''[[detect evil]]'', and operated in the same manner but for evil auras instead.
document_data.Effects: This spell functioned exactly like ''[[detect evil]]'' except it detected good auras from [[paladin]]s, good clerics, spells, magic items, etc. Just as poison did not show up as evil, beneficial potions did not register as good.
document_data.History: The arcane version of the ''[[detect evil]]''/''detect good'' spell was invented by [[Netheril|Netherese]] [[arcanist]] [[Trebbe]] in {{Yearlink|-2238}} under the name ''Trebbe's scry evil''/'''''Trebbe's scry good'''''.Only the primary form is named in the source. The name of the reversed form, ''Trebbe's scry good'', is chosen in analogy.
